title.native: 清純看護学院 新人ナース"祐未"恥虐の看護実習
title.romaji: Seijun Kango Gakuin: Shinjin Nurse "Yumi" Chigyaku no Kango Jisshuu

description:
Based on the erotic game by Anim.

You wouldn't think that a hospital would be the setting for a series of erotic adventures, but when a new crop of nurses' aides reports for duty, they're confronted by an erotic lesson plan that pushes them to the brink of ecstacy... and sanity.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Defloration
tags.description: Features a female character who has never had sexual relations (until now).

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Cunnilingus
tags.description: Features oral sex performed on female genitalia.

tags.name: Fellatio
tags.description: Blowjob; features oral sex performed on male genitalia.

tags.name: Anal Sex
tags.description: Features sexual penetration of the anal cavity.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Scissoring
tags.description: A form of sexual activity between women in which the genitals are stimulated by being rubbed against one another.

tags.name: Squirting
tags.description: Female ejaculation; features the expulsion of liquid from the female genitalia.

tags.name: Sex Toys
tags.description: Features objects that are designed to stimulate sexual pleasure.

tags.name: Boobjob
tags.description: Features the stimulation of male genitalia by breasts.

tags.name: Group Sex
tags.description: Features more than two participants engaged in sex simultaneously.

node.description:
[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

Hiroaki Sano is a composer and arranger.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hsano000)
http://hsano.sakura.ne.jp/

**Doujin Circle:** Heaven's Gate

[Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/ando_tomoya/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/andou_tomoya)

Andou Tomoya is a Japanese illustrator and adult game artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/新房昭之) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akiyuki_Shinbo)

Akiyuki Shinbou is a Japanese director, producer, animator and storyboard artist. He joined Studio One Pattern in 1981. He made his directorial debut with [Metal Fighter Miku](https://anilist.co/anime/1175/) in 1994. He joined Shaft in 2004. He has received the 11th Tokyo Anime Award and the 2011 Newtype Anime Award for Best director for his work on the acclaimed anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/).

Shinbou was born in Fukushima Prefecture. After high school, he attended Tokyo Designer Institute before entering the anime industry.

After graduating from Tokyo Design Institute, Shinbou worked as an animator for the 1981 anime series [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/). Shinbou participated with Studio Pierrot in 1990 as an episode director in [Musashi](https://anilist.co/anime/8065/). His first full directorial debut was however the previously mentioned, with Metal Fighter Miku. He continued his early directional career with several OVA series in the late 90's. Shinbou participated with Seven Arcs starting with [Triangle Heart: Sweet Songs Forever](https://anilist.co/anime/176/) in 2003 and then became director for 2004's spin-off [Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha](https://anilist.co/anime/76/).

His style in particular became noticed during his episode direction work on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392/)'s Dark Tournament arc. After seeing Shinbou's stylized presence, the new president of Shaft, [Mitsutoshi Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/151830/), approached Shinbou with the desire to make Shaft a distinctive studio among animation companies. In an interview, Kubota cited [Le Portrait de Petit Cossette](https://anilist.co/anime/514/) and [The SoulTaker](https://anilist.co/anime/1048/) among Shinbou's most distinctive products that caught his eye.

His work at Shaft has been characterized by extensive experimentation within the visual medium of animation, and often includes pictures taken from real life cut into scenes, as well as art shifts, beat panels, kabuki sound effects, textures that remain stationary when the textured object moves, showing symbols or defining parts of a character in place of characters during dialogue, written text in place (in opposition to dialogue), precise use of fan service, and "head-tilting", a style known as a Shaft specialty.

He says that the reason he sticks with Shaft is due to their system and professional capacity, which make his expression of direction much easier. The so-called "Team Shinbou" includes himself, [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and [Shin Oonuma](https://anilist.co/staff/101753/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

Kusakawa Keizou is a storyboarder and director working for [Seven Arcs](https://anilist.co/studio/35/Seven-Arcs). During his early years at the studio he has worked under [Shinbou Akiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/Akiyuki-Shinbou) and has since then been also involved in several shows directed by Shinbou at [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft). Kusakawa also took over the duties as director of the Lyrical Nanoha series from Shinbou after he left Seven Arcs, starting with its second season, Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's

Kusakawa Keizou is a storyboarder and director working for [Seven Arcs](https://anilist.co/studio/35/Seven-Arcs). During his early years at the studio he has worked under [Shinbou Akiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/Akiyuki-Shinbou) and has since then been also involved in several shows directed by Shinbou at [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft). Kusakawa also took over the duties as director of the Lyrical Nanoha series from Shinbou after he left Seven Arcs, starting with its second season, Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [older animator](https://anilist.co/staff/250761/) by the same name._
